tours.name: Labuan Bajo
tours.description: Labuan Bajo is a fishing town located at the western end of the large island of Flores in the Nusa Tenggara region of east Indonesia.
tours.address: Labuan Bajo, Flores, East Nusa Tenggara

tours.name: Kota Tua
tours.description: Kota Tua Jakarta is a neighborhood comprising the original downtown area of Jakarta, Indonesia. This is a great place to explore the history and culture of Jakarta.

tours.name: Candi Borobudur
tours.description: Borobudur is a 9th-century Mahayana Buddhist temple in Magelang, Central Java, Indonesia. It is the world's largest Buddhist temple.

tours.name: Pantai Kuta
tours.description: Kuta Beach is one of Bali's most famous and popular tourist destinations. It is known for its long sandy beach and great surf.

tours.name: Gunung Bromo
tours.description: Mount Bromo is an active volcano and part of the Tengger massif, in East Java, Indonesia. The area is one of the most visited tourist attractions in East Java.
tours.address: Bromo Tengger Semeru National Park, East Java

tours.name: Gunung Tangkuban Perahu
tours.description: Tangkuban Perahu is an active volcano located 30 km north of the city of Bandung, the provincial capital of West Java, Indonesia.
tours.address: Lembang, West Bandung Regency, West Java

tours.name: Dieng
tours.description: Dieng Plateau is a marshy plateau that forms the floor of a caldera complex on the Dieng Volcanic Complex near Wonosobo, Central Java, Indonesia.

tours.name: Pulau Komodo
tours.description: Komodo Island is one of the 17,508 islands that make up the Republic of Indonesia. The island is particularly notable as the habitat of the Komodo dragon.
tours.address: Komodo National Park, East Nusa Tenggara

tours.name: Pulau Raja Ampat
tours.description: Raja Ampat Islands are an Indonesian archipelago off the northwest tip of Bird's Head Peninsula in West Papua.

tours.name: Candi Prambanan
tours.description: Prambanan is a 9th-century Hindu temple compound in Central Java, dedicated to the Trimurti, the expression of God as the Creator (Brahma), the Preserver (Vishnu), and the Destroyer (Shiva).
